mil3.3.12:1.1: “Venerable Nāgasena, what is the distinguishing characteristic of consciousness?”
mil3.3.12:1.2: “Knowing, your majesty, is the distinguishing characteristic of consciousness?”
mil3.3.12:2.2: “Just as, your majesty, a town guardian sitting in the middle of the crossroads of the town would see a man coming from the eastern direction, the southern direction, the western direction, and the northern direction.
mil3.3.12:2.3: In the same way, your majesty, a person knows with consciousness whatever form he sees with his eyes,
mil3.3.12:2.4: he knows with consciousness whatever sound he hears with his ears,
mil3.3.12:2.5: he knows with consciousness whatever odour he smells with his nose,
mil3.3.12:2.6: he knows with consciousness whatever flavour he tastes with his tongue,
mil3.3.12:2.7: he knows with consciousness whatever touch he contacts with his body, and he knows with consciousness whatever thought he knows with his mind.
mil3.3.12:2.8: So too, your majesty, knowing is the distinguishing characteristic of consciousness?”
